byline.contributor: Oleg Matsnev and Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting.

abstract: Islam Karimov, former Uzbek president whose autocratic rule lasted for nearly thirty years, dies at age 78; his death marks end of what is often described as one of most brutal reigns to emerge from collapse of Soviet Union.

headline.print_headline: Islam Karimov Dies at 78, Ending a Long, Ruthless Rule of Uzbekistan
headline.main: Islam Karimov Dies at 78, Ending a Long, Ruthless Rule of Uzbekistan

snippet: Mr. Karimov’s nearly three-decade reign was often described as one of the most brutal to emerge after the collapse of the Soviet Union....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Karimov’s nearly three-decade reign was often described as one of the most brutal to emerge after the collapse of the Soviet Union.
